alert.note: Alert for Goshen; Laramie; Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 21 at 8:11PM MDT until June 21 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... Northwestern Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... Southeastern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 845 PM MDT. * At 811 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles south of Bordeaux to near Chugwater to 15 miles south of Slater to 15 miles northeast of Iron Mountain, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Chugwater and Slater. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 47 and 65. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
